description: Not of the form x^2 + x*y + y^2.
comments: Appears to be the sequence of nonsquare n such that sigma(n)==0 (mod 3). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Sep 17 2002First counterexample is 147 = 11^2 + 11*2 + 2^2 since sigma(147) = 3 * 76. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 29 2011Numbers n such that n-th coefficient of eta(x)^3/eta(x^3) is zero where eta(x) coefficients are given by A010815. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 06 2005A088534(a(n)) = 0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 30 2011
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Select[Range@ 105, ! Resolve[Exists[{x, y}, Reduce[# == x^2 + x y + y^2, {x, y}, Integers]]] &] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 06 2016 *)
prog: (PARI) default(seriesprecision, 105); for(n=1, 105, if (polcoeff(eta(x)^3/eta(x^3)+O(x^(n+1)), n) == 0, print1(n,","))) \\ _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 06 2005(PARI) x='x+O('x^100); p=eta(x)^3/eta(x^3); for(n=1, 99, if(polcoeff(p, n)==0, print1(n, ", "))); \\ _Altug Alkan_, Nov 08 2015(Haskell)a034020 n = a034020_list !! (n-1)a034020_list = f [0..] a003136_list where   f (x:xs) ys'@(y:ys) | x < y = x : f xs ys'                       | otherwise = f xs ys-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 30 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, May 04 2000
